<cs> my lords it is a great pleasure indeed for me to speak following the noble lord lord collison whose deep knowledge about agriculture is well recognised everywhere <e> <s> i congratulate the noble lord lord walston on the extremely able way in which he introduced the debate <e> <s> i also congratulate the noble earl lord ferrers on his present position and i look forward <e>

<cs> my lords i should like to say what an honour it is to me to follow my noble friend lord campbell but his speech and the speeches of other noble lords have had a very intimidating effect <e> <s> the expertise of my noble friend lord campbell in this field has been demonstrated today in a way that we in the subcommittee saw only too clearly <e> <s> i do not think i have ever heard a clearer exposition of the problems of the fishing industry than i have heard today <e>
